diff_hunk:
@@ -339,9 +339,10 @@ def __rpow__(self, other):
     __le__ = _C._VariableBase.le
     __gt__ = _C._VariableBase.gt
     __ge__ = _C._VariableBase.ge
+    __abs__ = _C._VariableBase.abs
 
     def __len__(self):
-        return len(self.data)
+        return self.shape[0]
body:
That's fine; I think an error message that indicates that's intentional is better than some out of bounds error; the later looks like a bug even if it isn't.  Numpy's error message is reasonable:
```
>>> len(np.array(0))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: len() of unsized object
```
